Bolivia - Segundo Proyecto del Seguro

projn: BO-Health Sector Reform Apl II -- P074212
subsc: Other social services,Health,Non-compulsory health finance,Sub-national government administration,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Health Sector Reform Program
            Project aims at continuing the results-driven approach to
            investments in the reduction of infant mortality, to
            increased coverage, and quality of health service networks,
            particularly among the most disadvantaged communities, and,
            to a strengthened local capacity responsive to health needs,
            as a complement to interventions in education, rural
            productivity, and water supply and sanitation. Thus, this
            environmental assessment, looks at the potential
            environmental adversity derived from other sector
            interventions, which may impact health, and, looks at the
            measures, and procedures to be taken to minimize adversity,
            proposing the following. Mitigation measures focus on
            accelerated drilling, and landfill works, to minimize air,
            and water pollution, to be followed by water sprinklers to
            control dust emissions. Appropriate drainage will control
            effluents, with an emphasis on sanitary water treatment to
            avoid contamination, though in the absence of sewage
            treatment, septic tanks, or borrow pits will be installed.
            Bacteriological analysis should be conducted periodically.
            Following appropriate personnel training, medical, and
            surgical hospital wastes will be collected, stored and
            incinerated, to be finally disposed of at sanitary
            landfills. Finally, reforestation practices, and vegetative
            propagation will mitigate ecological adversity.
